summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing the production of discovery materials. The production includes search warrant returns and data from electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein at the time of his arrest in 2019. The letter outlines the government's ongoing discovery obligations and includes a chart listing numerous subject devices.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, recipient of the discovery production letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (20 Cr. 330 (MN)), for whom discovery materials are being produced.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the individual from whom an iPhone (Subject Device-2) was seized by law enforcement at the time of his arrest in 2019. Data from this device is part of the discovery production.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The Acting United States Attorney who signed the letter transmitting the discovery materials to the defense counsel.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Law enforcement seized an iPhone (Subject Device-2) from Jeffrey Epstein at the time of his arrest.

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a hard drive and CD containing discovery materials, including search warrant returns and data from seized devices, to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Prior Discovery Production
events.description: The government had previously produced a portion of the responsive materials from seized devices to the defense team.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

keyFacts: The government produced discovery materials including search warrant returns and data from over 60 electronic devices (Subject Devices) seized in the investigation.
A specific iPhone (Subject Device-2, barcode E6516106) was seized from Jeffrey Epstein at the time of his arrest in 2019, and its data was part of the production.
The production was governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, and the letter itself was designated 'confidential.'
The document reveals the extensive scale of digital evidence collected, with many devices yielding no responsive material while others produced data on multiple dates in November 2020.
The letter is signed by Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, indicating high-level oversight of the discovery process in the Maxwell case.
